title: Analysis of Pre-Learning Activity Regularity and Its Link to Learning Outcomes in Flipped Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental scientific theories and professional practical experience
context.additional_context: A professional development program for pre-service or in-service teachers to enhance teaching competencies, focusing on advanced science education for professionals in blended environments utilizing digital devices.

learning_goals: Learners achieve a pre-learning activity completion rate of 80% or higher

Learners can set and record at least five weekly learning goals using time management metrics (e.g., Eisenhower Matrix, Pomodoro Technique) and submit execution logs demonstrating an 80%+ achievement rate.
Learners analyze the impact of regular participation patterns (3+ times per week) on learning outcomes in a flipped learning environment

During mid-term projects (2–4 weeks), learners can propose three improvement strategies reflecting pre-learning consistency metrics (attendance ≥80%, weekly assignment submission ≥90%) and draft a project evaluation plan applying these strategies.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
